title: 33a04  . Domestic service employees—CL.
text:
The
CL provisions of FLSA § 12, apply to domestic service employees only when such
employees are covered on an “individual” or “enterprise” basis, or if they are
employed in or about a home where homeworkers produce goods for commerce. 
Thus, unless such coverage exists, the prohibitions of § 12 do not apply. 
However, the MW and OT provisions of FLSA §§ 6(b) and 7(a)(1) are applicable,
pursuant to §§ 6(f) and 7(l) if the tests are met—unless such employment is
exempt under § 13(a)(15) or § 13(b)(21).  See 29 CFR 552.108.
html: The CL provisions of FLSA § 12, apply to domestic service employees only when such employees are covered on an “individual” or “enterprise” basis, or if they are employed in or about a home where homeworkers produce goods for commerce.  Thus, unless such coverage exists, the prohibitions of § 12 do not apply.  However, the MW and OT provisions of FLSA §§ 6(b) and 7(a)(1) are applicable, pursuant to §§ 6(f) and 7(l) if the tests are met—unless such employment is exempt under § 13(a)(15) or § 13(b)(21).  See 29 CFR 552.108.
